task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 85°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and base clearly to estimate its total height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
I’m now looking north and up instead of toward the building in the east, so I should rotate right to face ~85–90° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need the top of the main building in view, so I should tilt up while staying facing east.
The view again snapped to north while pitched up, so I need to rotate right to face the building at ~90°E with the same pitch to judge roof height.
I need both the base and the roofline in frame; from this position I should step closer to the building by moving left (the nearer node).
I’m no longer facing the building to the east, so I should rotate right to ~100° to bring the main facade back into view for a height estimate.
To estimate the building height I need the roofline visible, so I should tilt up while staying pointed east.
The view is again at north while pitched up, so I should rotate right to 90°E to keep the building in view and assess its top.
I appear very close to the building (0.4m move option), so I should slightly step left/forward to better frame the whole facade including base and roofline.
